abstract: The assertion by Representative Paul D. Ryan and others that cutting taxes stimulates growth that offsets the lost revenue is largely unsupported by experience or evidence, an economist writes.
snippet: The assertion by Representative Paul D. Ryan and others that cutting taxes stimulates growth that offsets the lost revenue is largely unsupported by experience or evidence, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

abstract: Only one named candidate has emerged, but a United States choice — and possibly other aspirants — should be clear by Friday.
snippet: Only one named candidate has emerged, but a United States choice — and possibly other aspirants — should be clear by Friday.
lead_paragraph: The deadline for nominations to become president of the World Bank is 6 p.m. Friday. Thus far, the only named candidate is Jeffrey Sachs, the development economist and director of the Earth Institute at Columbia University.

headline.main: Deadline Nears for World Bank Nominees
